squidpony.squidgrid.gui

Class TextCellFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.TextCellFactory

  • public class TextCellFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for creating text blocks. The size of the Font used during construction is considered an upper limit. If needed, the font size will be reduced until all characters can fit within the specified cell size. If all character fit in the specified cell size at the passed in Font size, no change to the Font size will occur. The default characters guaranteed to fit are ASCII 33 through 125, which are the commonly used symbols, numbers, and letters. In order to easily support Unicode, code points are used. All images have transparent backgrounds.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextCellFactory

        public TextCellFactory(java.awt.Font font,
                       int width,
                       int height)
        Builds the factory with the font fitting in the given size cell. Sizes down the font if needed to fit, but does not size up. The font will be rendered using antialias hinting. The default set of characters common to roguelikes will be used as the ones which will be guaranteed to fit.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font that the cells will be based on
        width - the width of each cell
        height - the height of each cell

      • TextCellFactory

        public TextCellFactory(java.awt.Font font,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       boolean antialias)
        Builds the factory with the font fitting in the given size cell. Sizes down the font if needed to fit, but does not size up. The default set of characters common to roguelikes will be used as the ones which will be guaranteed to fit.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font that the cells will be based on
        width - the width of each cell
        height - the height of each cell
        antialias - true for using antialias hints during rendering

      • TextCellFactory

        public TextCellFactory(java.awt.Font font,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       boolean antialias,
                       int padding)
        * Builds the factory with the font fitting in the given size cell. Sizes down the font if needed to fit, but does not size up.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font that the cells will be based on
        width - the width of each cell
        height - the height of each cell
        antialias - true for using antialias hints during rendering
        padding - the minimum number of empty pixels on all sides of the cell

      • TextCellFactory

        public TextCellFactory(java.awt.Font font,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       boolean antialias,
                       int padding,
                       java.lang.String fitting)
        * Builds the factory with the font fitting in the given size cell. Sizes down the font if needed to fit, but does not size up.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font that the cells will be based on
        width - the width of each cell
        height - the height of each cell
        antialias - true for using antialias hints during rendering
        padding - the minimum number of empty pixels on all sides of the cell
        fitting - a String containing all characters that will be guaranteed to fit

        public TextCellFactory(java.awt.Font font,
                       int width,

                       int topPadding,

        * Builds the factory with the font fitting in the given size cell. Sizes down the font if needed to fit, but does not size up.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font that the cells will be based on
        width - the width of each cell
        height - the height of each cell
        antialias - true for using antialias hints during rendering
        topPadding - the minimum number of empty pixels at the top of the cell
        bottomPadding - the minimum number of empty pixels at the bottom of the cell
        leftPadding - the minimum number of empty pixels at the left of the cell
        rightPadding - the minimum number of empty pixels at the right of the cell

      • willFit

        public boolean willFit(int codepoint)
        Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell dimensions with the current font. ISO Control characters, non-printing characters and invalid unicode characters are all considered by definition to fit.
        Parameters:
        codepoint -
        Returns:
